\chapter{Abstract}
\label{\detokenize{index:abstract}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The project aims to provide a comprehensive and interactive visual
representation of subsurface geology by creating three\sphinxhyphen{}dimensional
images of seismic volumes in \sphinxstylestrong{MayaVI} library. The project will
facilitate a better understanding of subsurface geology by allowing
users to interact with the data in a more intuitive and efficient manner
utilizing \sphinxstylestrong{TraitsUI} library. Visualization of seismic volumes is a
very crucial component of interpretation workflows, be it to pick salt
domes, interpret horizons, identify fault planes, or classify rock
facies.


\chapter{Outline}
\label{\detokenize{index:outline}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The project will involve the following steps:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Collecting seismic data and processing it to generate seismic
volumes.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Converting the seismic volumes into 3D models (numpy arrays) using a
specialized python module \sphinxstyleemphasis{segyio}.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Developing an interactive user interface that allows the user to
visualize and manipulate the 3D models, using \sphinxstylestrong{TraitsUI}.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Adding functionalities for analysis using \sphinxstyleemphasis{matplotlib} and \sphinxstylestrong{mayaVI}
to be able to identify fault planes, classification of rock
structures, etc.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Adding features such as colouring, slicing, and annotation to enhance
the interpretability of the data.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Experiments with popular datasets and demonstration of results of our
application corresponding to multiple use cases.

\end{itemize}

&\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\sphinxmidrule
\sphinxtableatstartofbodyhook
\sphinxAtStartPar
1
&
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxhref{https://public.3.basecamp.com/p/JyT276MM7krjYrMoLqLQ6xST}{3D seismic data NZPM}
&
\sphinxAtStartPar
Seismic data is publicly available and provided by New Zealand Petroleum and Minerals (NZPM)
\\
\sphinxhline
\sphinxAtStartPar
2
&
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxhref{https://github.com/olivesgatech/facies\_classification\_benchmark\#dataset}{3D seismic data Netherlands F3 Block}
&
\sphinxAtStartPar
Developed by the OLIVES lab at Georgia Tech
\\
\sphinxhline
\sphinxAtStartPar
3
&
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxhref{https://pubs.usgs.gov/of/2009/1151/data/seismics/segy/}{3D seismic data US}
&
\sphinxAtStartPar
3D seismic data provided by the USGS
\\
\sphinxbottomrule
\end{tabulary}

\chapter{Setup}
\label{\detokenize{index:setup}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Clone the repository
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{git clone https://github.com/rajagond/AE6102\_sifar.git}}

\end{itemize}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
On \sphinxstylestrong{Ubuntu 22.04} with \sphinxstylestrong{python 3.10}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{libxcb\sphinxhyphen{}xinerama0}} need
to be installed with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{apt}}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{sudo apt install python3.10}}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{sudo apt install python3\sphinxhyphen{}pip}}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{sudo apt install libxcb\sphinxhyphen{}xinerama0}}

\end{itemize}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Install Required Packages
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pip install \sphinxhyphen{}r docs/requirements.txt}}

\end{itemize}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Virtual Environment
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{python3.10 \sphinxhyphen{}m venv venv}}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{source venv/bin/activate}}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pip3 install \sphinxhyphen{}r requirements.txt}}

\end{itemize}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Documentation Generation (Sphinx)
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{sphinx\sphinxhyphen{}build \sphinxhyphen{}\sphinxhyphen{}version}}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{sphinx\sphinxhyphen{}quickstart docs}}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{sphinx\sphinxhyphen{}build \sphinxhyphen{}b html docs/source/ docs/build/html}}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{google\sphinxhyphen{}chrome docs/build/html/index.html}}

\end{itemize}

\end{itemize}
